description.narrative: The overall project objective is to position women and women’s issues in governance processes at local and national level. The specific objectives are: 1) To strengthen women’s participation in decision making structures and processes and 2) To facilitate community members to demand local leaders ‘accountability. The main problem being addressed by the project is the low representation and participation of women in decision making processes, marginalisation of women and women voices, experiences and needs. This is despite the provisions in the current Consitution of Zimbabwe that set legal and prescriptive rights for gender parity in representation. Within the socio-political domain, women do not engage in public affairs and where they engage, they are few with their voices and their influence in political processes at different level is  limited. This means that women’s experiences, perspectives, demands and rights are not even a part of decision making at national level. Rights holders for this project mainly include women in selected communities, women Members of Parliament, women Councillors and women in Political Parties. This will include women in a range of decision-making structures, including governance structures and community development committees, particularly those in constituencies represented by women at local and national levels.  This project mainly falls within the Democracy intervention area (strengthening democratic culture objective) in the current Diakonia Zimbabwe’s Strategic Plan for 2016-2020. It will be implemented by Women in Politics Support Unit (WIPSU) in selected districts in Masvingo and Matabeleland South provinces.
This project mainly contributes to results within Women's political participation. Results will be reported later in the Global Civsam grant period 2016-2020
